intro: Schizoglossum truncatulum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are narrow and often have a truncate or notched tip. It produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. Schizoglossum truncatulum is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
